page.title: 07COLAN WOODS
page.content: The landscape is mostly grass with some ceareals such as barley and wheat. The land at the {FIR HILL is very hilly with a lot of country lanes and tracks,mostly made of rubble and over grown with trees. In the Fir Hill there are many derelict buildings as it used to be a mining settlement. The land is covered with trees and grass. The trees lean over the road and include pines, ash, sycamore, chestnut and hazel. There were quite a few hedgerows which have been left overgrown. In the wood there are lots of small tracks. On one of these there is a small car dump. The area at { {COLAN WOODS} is very shaded. Along the side of the footpath there is a little marshy ground and a small stream running through into PORTH RESERVOIR.
